reviews.sentence: Great new hotel. DusitD2 is an excellent addition to the hotel scene in Nairobi. A pool under development and some greater choice quality for breakfast could complete probably what can easily be the best choice both for business or leisure short stays while in Nairobi.

Beautiful Hotel but Poor Service. This hotel is beautiful. It was very clean and the room was spacious. However the hotel could improve on service delivery. Upon arriving at this hotel four hours prior to check in time after 26 hours of traveling I was told I could not check into my room early unles I paid 50 cost of one days room charges. The receptionist kept referring to me as an expedia guest since I purchased my hotel through Hotelscom. She even called the manager to see if I could get into the room early but once she said I was an expedia guest the manager said I would have to pay the charges. Furthermore while I was having breakfast at the hotel the following morning the restaurant manager approached two guests and told them they needed to move form the four top table they were sitting at to a two top table. The restaurant was empty and had plenty of available tables. so I am not quite sure why they asked them to move. I and 25 of my colleagues each travel through Nairobi around 8 times a year. I would have definitely recommended this hotel to others had they treated me better upon arrival. However I will return to the hotel I normally stay at for all future travel in Nairobi. The Sankara hotel is far superior located better has more comfortable beds and has far superior customer service. So if you want a truly outstanding stay while visiting Nairobi opt for The Sankara over DusitD2.

Hotel okay poor execution. Spent one night here. Arranged an airport pickup was promised an Porsche Cayenne in the reservation paperwork got a small Mercedes instead I am a big guy so was a bit cramped. Hotel staff were pleasant. Room was nice. Has HOT water in the bathroom sink. NO HOT WATER in the shower or tub. Hm. Even with a DO NOT DISTURB light housekeeping knocked on the door ay 930AM wanting to clean the room. So NICE HOTEL. POOR EXECUTION.

Terrible service at Soko Restaurant. we came to Soko for birthday dinner for a friend. Dinner from a set menu took 4 hours to be served. The waiter service is slow and only 1 was assigned to our party of 25 diners. The restaurant was empty so the other waiters were just hanging out and not willing to help serve our table. Apparently because they were not assigned to us. We literally had to serve ourselves. To cap it all we ordered for a round of drinks at 11 pm which never came. when we asked again at 1215am the server says we have closedIn a nutshell terrible reception lacklustre service disinterested manager. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Nice Place. A gorgeous and very secure property. So much to see and do in Nairobi that you will not spend much time at the hotel. Not really walking distance to anything but staff will help arrange a taxi for a fair price if you ask.

Friendly staff and great service. I stayed one week and enjoyed great service but above all very friendly staff. The hotel is modern with good sized rooms and everything clean. Even with the hotel full there was always a table available in the bar and restaurant. The food was good the pool area is great but a short walk from the main building. Overall I am very happy to stay there again.

Best service and staff ever. As a hotel it has the basic amenities gym restaurants bar business center etc. but what was exceptional was the service provided after had checked out of the hotel. My stay was a five night stay. I had a red eye flight back to US via Amsterdam on Saturday night. So arranged for a tour to see elephant orphanage giraffe conservation center and game ride in Nairobi National Park. Got back from the day at around 630pm and the hotel allowed me to use the gym showers to clean up and change before heading out to airport for my midnight flight. Just want to do a shout out for Beatrice Brian and Margaret. as these staff offered the service and helped get luggage up to the gym. This was such an unexpected surprise. I think Dusit will now be my preferred hotel when they have one where I am traveling.
Enjoyable visit. Would love to visit again. Nice and comfortable.

The owner of the Dusit Thani Hotel New Cairo Egypt is a well known pedophile. His name is Emad El Hazek. The hotel is a front for a brothel and illicit drug ring. Many government authorities know about it and they refuse to respond. El Hazek allows Ahmed Salah and Rady Rady run the day to day criminal activity. If you look at the reviews on tripadvisor hotels booking etc. You will find many guests complain about stealing. The employees are trained to steal from the guest rooms. El Hazek is well known for stealing property from the Egyptian government. He was sentenced to jail and a fine. And he got out of both. So this encouraged him to increase his criminal activity. He is successful because Dusit Thani is headquartered in Thailand a nation who ’s economy thrives on illicit drugs prostitution and thievery LifeFitnes based in Rosemont Illinois is fully aware of the criminal activity and continues to supply Dusit Thani Body Temple Gym and Devarana Spa. Whenever a guest or member refuses to participate in this criminal activity and complains about the unrelenting begging by the employees of Dusit the guest or member is refused a refund gets his or her money stolen from them and is not allowed to step on the premises. Emad El Hazek has been emboldened by the lack of punishment he has received. Since he has been emboldened by his lack of punishment he has increased his criminal activity through Dusit Thani Hotel New Cairo Egypt and all other enterprises that he owns or has controlling interest in.

An amazing romantic den in planet earth. awesome all the way. This is to register my gratitude with compliments and appreciation for the service and care I received at The Dusit D2 Nairobi. I took my wife ric above on our first outing in almost 3 years and I wanted it to be perfect. The staff did not disappoint me. Every staff member with whom we came in contact with particularly the Porters and then Receptionists were so attentive and kind enough without forgetting the housekeeping and room service. Soko was just superb and extending to Soi for the Tapaz bites complete with a visit to Devarana Spa was just something out of this planet. We have already decided to return to this Hotel for our next vacation which will give us slightly a longer stay worthy for such a beautiful place guaranteeing maximum enjoyment with pleasure. Thank you again DusitD2 Nairobi for such an outstanding service.

Great hotel with amazing service. I had a really pleasant stay. The room was comfortable and the staff were incredibly professional and helpful. Breakfast halal options were limited though but sufficient to get along. The hotel wifi was very good and allowed me to work and stay in touch with family back home in ease.

Bespoke and executive. The swift upgrade to a room on the 6th floor My favorite was amazing. No sooner had I requested than the upgrade was made. The spa as well was bespoke. Surely Dusit Nairobi you are amazing. Non at all. Keep up the amazing standards you have set. The bar is set by you guys.
They have the best service and I loved the interior decor.

New Year ’s Eve Mini break in the city. For the second year in a row my wife and I checked into Dusit D2 in Riverside NAIROBI. We had a wonderful stay the previous year and valued the mini break and the indulgence of a nice hotel stay over News Years. Free to celebrate and welcome the New Year in luxury. D2 offers discount rates for residents over the Christmas and New Years period which only makes the decision to indulge a little easier. 19 for a double and 25 each for breakfast sadly not as good last year but still great value. Great hotel and great amenities and conviently located and great service and drinks at the Zing bar and lounge.

Soko Restaurant. Had an amazing experience and service from Darwin was exceptional would highly recommend it. The food was also top and the mocktails and drinks were also really good also loved the ambience which was very calm.

An unforgettable experience. Dusit Team Thank you to your team specifically Eva the Events Manager for your exceptional hospitality. My girls and I had such a wonderful and unforgettable experience at the Zing restaurant. I was impressed by how fast we were served and how friendly the staff were. I look forward to coming back.

Cocktails. Zing bar the ambience is out of this world I was served by the lovely Angel Riviera very friendly and it felt like home. Her signature cocktail smoked charm blew me away and I will always make a point to visit whenever I am in town.

Comforting stay. Stayed for a week at Dusit D2 while on work visit last month. In short summary fab hotel fab staff fab room and fab facilitiesLocation was perfect considering my office was in the very next block. Room was of grand size spacious and clean. Staff were super extra friendly Special mention to Carol at Zing and Soko restaurant for a great service. Speaking of restaurants breakfast was self sufficient although larger range of buffet spread would have helped. Had dinner at Soko couple of nights Asian menu was superAfter the heinous terror attack at Dusit D2 campus at start of 2019 the site security had been stepped up. Which was very assuring. Every time I visit my Nairobi office here on Dusit D2 will be my go to hotel for stay.
Fancy location Great for drinks Food is nice also They have amazing pools.
